intro: Lopezia annua, commonly known as the annual Lopezia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family, which includes many species with showy flowers and often hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Lopezia annua produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. It is an annual species, completing its life cycle within a single growing season.
